prompt:
Describe the spatial relationships in this diagram.

CONTAINMENT: Which text labels are inside or outside each closed curve?
CONNECTIONS: Which text labels are connected by lines? Note any branching or unconnected lines.
BOUNDARY CROSSINGS: Do any lines cross the boundaries of closed curves?
NESTING: Are any closed curves nested inside others?

Do not interpret meaning. Only describe what you see spatially.
evaluation:
# Spatial Description of the Diagram

## CONTAINMENT:
- **"disgraces"** is inside the upper closed curve
- **"wounded"** is inside the lower closed curve
- **"man"** is outside all closed curves (positioned to the left)

## CONNECTIONS:
- A line extends from the word **"man"** and branches into two paths
- The branching occurs where the line meets the closed curves
- One branch connects to the upper curve (containing "disgraces")
- One branch connects to the lower curve (containing "wounded")

## BOUNDARY CROSSINGS:
- The main line from "man" approaches the closed curves but the exact crossing point is where the branching occurs
- The branches appear to terminate at or enter the boundaries of each respective closed curve
- No lines clearly pass completely through both curves

## NESTING:
- The two closed curves (containing "disgraces" and "wounded") appear to be adjacent or overlapping rather than one being nested inside the other
- Both curves seem to share a common boundary or are very close together on their left side where the branching line meets them
- Neither curve is completely contained within the other
